result.markdown: --- title: "About Me" page-layout: full title-block-banner: true margin-header: | ![](images/pexels-madison-inouye-2622186.jpg) about: template: solana image: images/headshot.jpg links: - icon: linkedin text: LinkedIn href: https://www.linkedin.com/in/claire-hsieh-539456174/ - icon: github text: Github href: https://github.com/claire-hsieh listing: contents: posts/welcome type: default categories: false sort: date asc sort-ui: false filter-ui: false html: css: styles.css toc: true mainfont: Century Gothic --- ::: {.cell} ::: Hi! My name is Claire and I'm currently a student at UC Davis majoring in Genetics and Genomics and planning to pursue a PhD in Biostatistics. My research interests are in statistical genetics and machine learning which I hope to apply in cancer and Alzheimer's research. I love to read with my favorite genres being Fantasy and Sci-fi! ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {#title} # Skills ::: ::: card-css ::: temp ::: card-header ::: card-img-top ::: Python ::: ::: card-text Capable of utilizing data structures and Python packages (Pandas, Numpy) to create predictive models and general purpose algorithms ::: ::: ::: temp ::: {.card-header style="display: flex"} ::: card-img-top ::: Linux ::: ::: card-text Used for bioinformatics processing (ie BLAST). Capable of writing bash/shell scripts. ::: ::: ::: temp ::: {.card-header style="display: flex"} ::: card-img-top ::: Perl ::: ::: card-text Capable of building basic algorithms using Perl\ ::: ::: ::: temp ::: {.card-header style="display: flex"} ::: card-img-top ::: R ::: ::: card-text Able to create regression, classification, and prediction models as well as various data visualization methods ::: ::: ::: temp ::: {.card-header style="display: flex"} ::: card-img-top ::: Matlab ::: ::: card-text Able to create predictive models and simulations ::: ::: ::: ::: {#title1 .title} # Education ::: ::: {#education1 .education} ## [University of California, Davis]{style="color:DarkCyan;"} 2020 - 2024 B.S. in Genetics and Genomics Minor in Statistics, Quantitative Biology and Bioinformatics GPA: 3.7 Extracurricular Activities: - Social Media Officer of the Davis Data Science Club - Member of the Aggie Fiction Writing Workshop ::: ::: {#title2 .title} # Experiences ::: ::: {#experience1 .experience} ## Research Assistant [**Topological Molecular Biology Lab**](https://arsuaga-vazquez-lab.faculty.ucdavis.edu/){style="color:DarkCyan;"} Apr 2021 - Present \| Davis, CA The Arsuaga-Vasquez lab utilizes topological methods to study the 3D organization of DNA and proteins. **Responsibilities**: - Analyzed viral datasets to extract and annotate proteins using sequence and structural similarity - Utilized profile HMMs in predicting SARS COV-2 mutation probabilities weighted by country - Cleaned and aligned genomic datasets using MAFFT and Clustal Omega - Grew and collected microbial cultures - Set up and performed gel electrophoresis - Prepared frozen samples using GP2 and imaged using Cryo-EM - Designed primers and performed qPCR to quantify DNA - Extracted DNA using miniprep or chloroform ::: ::: {#experience2 .experience} ## Research Assitant [Korf Lab](http://korflab.ucdavis.edu/about.html){style="color:DarkCyan;"} Dec 2022 - Present \| Davis, CA The Korf lab studies the structure and function of various genes and genetic elements using computational methods. **Responsibilities**: - Developed Python programs that use intron position to predict gene enhancement - Examined orthologous genes to identify introns with potential for enhancing genes - Created algorithms to identify motifs using discretized position weight matrices, regular expressions, and k-mers - Implemented a Stochastic Viterbi and forward-backwards algorithm in Python to generate random, probable isoforms ::: ::: ::: {#experience3 .experience} ## Intern [Irvine Summer Institute in Biostatistics and Undergraduate Data Science](https://isi-buds.github.io/program-2023/){style="color:DarkCyan;"} Jul 2023 - Aug 2023 \| Irvine, CA A six-week program that focused on teaching students the fundamentals of statistical research through both classroom and hands-on research experience. At the end of the program, students presented their findings at a symposium. **Responsibilities:** - Learned fundamentals of probability, Monte Carlo methods, linear models, generalized linear models, causal inference, and Bayesian statistics - Used R and machine learning to predict presence of colorectal cancer using metabolomics ::: ::: {#experience4 .experience} ## Accounting Assistant [Quicklinks Advisor 365](https://qna365.com){style="color:DarkCyan;"} Aug 2020 - Dec 2022 \| Chino, CA Quicklinks Advisor 365 provides accounting and bookkeeping services, Quickbooks consulting and training, and tax preparation and planning. **Responsibilities:** - Reconcile transactions and identify discrepancies - Create and update financial statements :::
